title: Yochlol
html:
Yochlol

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
& yochlol (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks Tentacle 1d12 physical, Tentacle 1d12 physical, Single-target (active) gaze attack 1d20 study
& yochlol (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks

Tentacle 1d12 physical, Tentacle 1d12 physical, Single-target (active) gaze attack 1d20 study

Base level 10
Base experience 346
Speed 12
Base AC -1
Base MR 19
Alignment -10 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium
Resistances fire, poison

A yochlol:

  • can flow under doors.
  • can survive underwater.
  • does not breathe.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a demon.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • resists death magic.
  • may turn against you when tame.

A yochlol, &, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack. The yochlol is a humanoid female major demon associated with the drow goddess Lolth that can shift into various forms:

  • A stinking cloud, v
  • An unearthly drow, @
  • A demonic black widow, s

In all forms, yochlol are strong, amphibious and breathless and can be seen via infravision. They will seek out items to pick up, and can follow the hero to other floors if they are adjacent - tame yochlol may also turn traitor. The other attributes of yochlol depend on their current form:

  • In her base demon form, a yochlol is amorphous. She has two tentacle attacks and a single-target studying gaze attack, and possesses fire resistance, poison resistance, drain resistance, and death resistance.
  • In stinking cloud form, yochlol have a poisonous engulfing attack and a second engulfing attack, and possess sleep resistance, stoning resistance and sickness resistance in addition to their demon form's resistances.
  • In unearthly drow form, they have a seduction-inducing bite, a weapon attack, and the ability to cast a clerical monster spell with five hit dice during each of their turns, and only possess sleep resistance, drain resistance and death resistance.
  • In demonic black widow form, they have a blood-draining bite and two kick attacks that spread webs, and only possess poison resistance, drain resistance and death resistance.

Yochlol are poisonous to consume, which primarily comes up if they are digested by another monster or subjected to Ahazu.

Generation

Yochlol are only randomly generated in Gehennom, and randomly-generated yochlol are always hostile.

Yochlol do not leave a corpse upon death.

Origin

Yochlol are lesser demonic abominations from the Forgotten Realms D&D setting, known as the "Handmaidens of Lolth". They are natural shapeshifters that can take on oozing and gaseous forms, as well as arachnid and humanoid ones.

  • does not breathe.
  • has no eyes.

A '''yochlol''', {{black|&}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]]. The yochlol is a [[humanoid]] female [[major demon]] associated with the [[Drow (monster attribute)|drow]] [[goddess]] [[Lolth (dNetHack)|Lolth]] that can shift into various forms:

* A '''stinking cloud''', {{black|v}}
* An '''unearthly drow''', {{black|@}}
* A '''demonic black widow''', {{black|s}}

In all forms, yochlol are [[strong]], [[amphibious]] and [[breathless]] and can be seen via [[infravision]]. They will seek out items to pick up, and can [[follow]] the [[hero]] to other floors if they are adjacent - [[tame]] yochlol may also turn [[traitor]]. The other attributes of yochlol depend on their current form:

* In her base demon form, a yochlol is [[amorphous]]. She has two tentacle attacks and a single-target [[study]]ing [[gaze attack]], and possesses [[fire resistance]], [[poison resistance]], [[drain resistance]], and [[death resistance]].
* In stinking cloud form, yochlol have a [[poisonous]] [[engulfing]] attack and a second engulfing attack, and possess [[sleep resistance]], [[stoning resistance]] and [[sickness resistance]] in addition to their demon form's resistances.
* In unearthly drow form, they have a [[seduction]]-inducing bite, a weapon attack, and the ability to cast a clerical [[dNetHack monster spells|monster spell]] with five hit dice during each of their turns, and only possess sleep resistance, drain resistance and death resistance.
* In demonic black widow form, they have a blood-draining bite and two kick attacks that [[Webbing|spread webs]], and only possess poison resistance, drain resistance and death resistance.

Yochlol are [[poison]]ous to consume, which primarily comes up if they are [[digest]]ed by another monster or subjected to [[Ahazu]].

==Generation==
Yochlol are only randomly generated in [[Gehennom]], and randomly-generated yochlol are always hostile.

Yochlol [[Corpseless|do not leave a corpse]] upon death.

==Origin==
Yochlol are lesser demonic abominations from the Forgotten Realms D&D setting, known as the "Handmaidens of Lolth". They are natural shapeshifters that can take on oozing and gaseous forms, as well as arachnid and humanoid ones.
